column2: Meaning
column5: Sentence

column2: a person who pleads for a person, cause, or idea
column5: they advocated an ethical foreign policy

column2: without giving a name

column2: enough to be estimated or measured

column2: fearful expectation or anticipation
column5: he felt sick with apprehension

column2: so extremely old as seeming to belong to an earlier period
column5: prisons are run on archaic methods

column2: the state when one person or group has power over another
column5: the ascendancy of good over evil

column2: marked by active interest and enthusiasm
column5: an avid reader of science fiction

column2: something that is desirable, favorable, or beneficial

column2: having or revealing supreme mastery or skill
column5: they did not consummate their marriage until months after it took place

column2: an insufficient quantity or number
column5: there is a dearth of evidence

column2: reduce in worth or character, usually verbally
column5: she thought that many supposedly erotic pictures degraded women

column2: turn away from by persuasion

column2: recognize or perceive the difference

column2: skillful at evading capture
column5: success will become ever more elusive

column2: native; originating where it is found
column5: there are three types of island endemics

column2: any new participant in some activity
column5: Only female hummingbirds are involved in parental care; they must incubate eggs, brood young hatchlings, and feed the chicks as nestlings and fledglings.

column2: walk with great difficulty
column5: he was floundering about in the shallow offshore waters

column2: laugh boisterously

column2: be a hindrance or obstacle to
column5: the sap causes swelling that can impede breathing

column2: uninterrupted in time and indefinitely long continuing
column5: the incessant beat of the music

column5: she sounded in a jocular mood

column5: an incurable malady

column2: capable of being shaped or bent

column2: showing a brooding ill humor
column5: she was morose and silent when she got home

column5: they discussed the accident in muted voices

column2: stubbornly persistent in wrongdoing
column5: I argued this point with him, but he was obdurate

column2: marked by complexity and richness of detail

column2: treat condescendingly
